definition: lit. no antidote is possible (idiom); incurable/incorrigible/beyond redemption
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: He is still, in the eyes of some, an irredeemable misogynist.
sentences.chinese: 在某些人的眼里，他仍然是个无可救药的厌恶女性者。

sentences.english: And third, I was unconditionally and irrevocably in love with him. ----from.
sentences.chinese: 第三，我毫无条件地，也无可救药地爱上了他。

sentences.english: India is also hopelessly outflanked in the arms race.
sentences.chinese: 此外，印度还无可救药的陷入了军备竞赛。

sentences.english: Go to the library on weekends? You are a certifiable bookworm.
sentences.chinese: 周末还去图书馆？你真是一个无可救药的书呆子。

sentences.english: You must know by now that he's quite hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 如今你总该知道他是完全无可救药了。

sentences.english: Was he seized at the age of forty-six with a supreme madness?
sentences.chinese: 四十六岁，他便害了无可救药的狂病吗？

sentences.english: He just insanely believes he's Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 他无可救药地认为自己是拿破仑。

sentences.english: He remained gloomy, narrow and hopelessly addicted to conventional wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 他依旧阴郁，险隘，无可救药地醉心于传统的智慧中。

sentences.english: Such are the intricate thought processes of the irredeemably foolish.
sentences.chinese: 就是这些傻得无可救药的想法缠绕着我。

sentences.english: But the weakening of the English seemed irremediable.
sentences.chinese: 但是英军的困惫看来是无可救药的。

sentences.english: For father and myself she was incurably ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 对于她的父亲和我是无可救药雄心勃勃。

sentences.english: My Lord, he's hopelessly out of date.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，他是无可救药地过时了。

sentences.english: They're a hopeless mess. They get everything wrong.
sentences.chinese: 简直糟糕得无可救药，真是成事不足败事有余。

definition: see 無可救藥|无可救药[wu2 ke3 jiu4 yao4]
lit. the disease has attacked the vitals (idiom); fig. beyond cure/the situation is hopeless
lit. from head to tail (idiom); thoroughgoing/through and through/out and out/from top to bottom
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
